ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I'd totally recommend it for anyone interested in Semantics. It was a great course.

Semantics II provides essential insights into the goals of the subfield and the desiderata of semantics publications. It hugely enriches the material of semantics I. It's delivered with enthusiasm and rigor. If you have any interest in the representation of meaning this is an essential.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course provided a whole new toolbox and sowed the seeds for any semantic work in the future.

It was a great introduction to how to tackle a research question in a field that is hard to start doing research on. It broadened my understanding of Semantics and helped me build grit and autonomy for my graduate studies.
